Verses.1: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
Verses.2: In the beginning He was with God.
Verses.3: Through Him all things came into being. And without Him, nothing that has ever existed, has come to be.
Verses.4: In Him was life, and that life was the Light of all peoples.
Verses.5: And that Light shines in the darkness, and the darkness did not subdue it.
Verses.6: There came another sent from God, and his name was John.
Verses.7: He came to be a witness, to testify about the Light, so that through him all might believe.
Verses.8: He was not the Light, rather he came to tell us about the Light.
Verses.9: That the true Light was coming into the world to enlighten everyone.
Verses.10: He was in the world, and creation was made through Him, yet creation did not know Him.
Verses.11: He came to His own people, and they rejected Him.
Verses.12: But to all who accept Him, to those who believed in His name, He gave them the right to become children of God.
Verses.13: Children who were not born of blood, nor the will of the flesh, nor of a person's will, but of God.
Verses.14: And the Word became flesh and lived among us. We saw His glory. The glory of the only Son from the Father, full of grace and truth
Verses.15: John testified about Him. He cried out, saying, "This is the one I spoke of when I said, 'He, who is coming after me, far surpasses me because he existed before me.'"
Verses.16: We have all received from His abundance. Grace upon grace.
Verses.17: For the Law was given through Moses; grace and truth came through Jesus Christ.
Verses.18: No one has ever seen God. God's only Son, who is in the arms of the Father, has revealed Him.
Verses.19: Now this was the testimony John gave when Jewish leaders sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, "Who are you?"
Verses.20: He declared, did not deny, and freely confessed, "I am not the Christ."
Verses.21: Then they asked him, "What then? Are you Elijah?" And he said, "I am not." "Are you the Prophet?" And he answered, "No."
Verses.22: Then they said to him, "Who are you? Give us an answer for those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?"
Verses.23: He said, "I am a voice of one crying out in the wilderness. 'Make straight the way of the Lord,' as the prophet Isaiah said."
Verses.24: Now they had been sent from the Pharisees.
Verses.25: They questioned him, "Why then do you baptize if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the Prophet?"
Verses.26: John answered them, saying, "I baptize in water. Yet, among you stands One you do not know.
Verses.27: He is the One who comes after me; whose sandal strap I am unworthy to even untie."
Verses.28: These things took place in Bethany across the Jordan, where John was baptizing.
Verses.29: The next day, he saw Jesus coming to him and said, "Behold! The Lamb of God who takes away the sins of the world!
Verses.30: This is the One I spoke of when I said, 'After me is coming a Man who far surpasses me, because He existed before me.'
Verses.31: I didn't recognize Him. I came, baptizing in water, so that He would be revealed to Israel."
Verses.32: Then John testified, saying, "I saw the Spirit descending from heaven as a dove and it remained upon Him.
Verses.33: I did not recognize Him. He who sent me to baptize in water told me, 'You see the one who the Spirit is descending upon and remains. This is the One who baptizes with the Holy Spirit.'
Verses.34: I have seen and testified that this is the Son of God."
Verses.35: The next day, John was standing there again with two of his disciples.
Verses.36: When Jesus walked by, John looked at Him and said, "Behold! The Lamb of God!"
Verses.37: The two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.
Verses.38: And Jesus turned and saw them following Him. He asked them, "What are you seeking?" They said, "Rabbi (which means 'Teacher'), where are you staying?"
Verses.39: He replied, "Come, and you will see." So they went and saw where He was staying. They stayed with Him that day; it was about the tenth hour.
Verses.40: Andrew, Simon Peter's brother, was one of the two who heard John speak, and followed Jesus.
Verses.41: The first thing he did was find his brother Simon and tell him, "We have found the Messiah" (which means 'Christ').
Verses.42: He brought him to Jesus. Jesus looked at him and said, "You are Simon the son of John. You shall be called Cephas" (which translates to Peter).
Verses.43: The next day, Jesus decided to go to Galilee. He found Philip, and said to him, "Follow Me."
Verses.44: Philip was from Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.
Verses.45: Philip found Nathanael and told him, "We have found the one Moses wrote about in the Law, and who the prophets also spoke of: Jesus the son of Joseph, from Nazareth!"
Verses.46: Nathanael asked him, "Can anything good come from Nazareth?" Philip said, "Come and see!"
Verses.47: Jesus saw Nathanael approaching Him, and said of him, "Here truly is an Israelite who has no deceit in him."
Verses.48: "How do You know me?" Nathanael asked. Jesus answered, "I saw you before Philip called you. While you were still under the fig tree."
Verses.49: Nathanael answered Him, "Rabbi, You are the Son of God! You are the King of Israel!"
Verses.50: Jesus answered him, saying, "Do you believe because I told you, 'I saw you under the fig tree'? You will see greater things than these."
Verses.51: And He added, "Truly, truly, I tell you that you will see heaven opened and the angels of God ascending and descending on the Son of Man."

InlineTitles.6: The Witness of John the Baptist
InlineTitles.19: John the Baptist's Testimony of Jesus

Changes: 2024-01-28 - Paul Prins: First translation of verses 14-51.
2022-12-16 - Paul Prins: First translation of chapter 1:1-14.
2022-12-06 - Paul Prins: First translation of chapter 1:23.
